intro: Melliodendron wangianum, commonly known as the Wangian melilot, is a flowering plant native to New Guinea. It belongs to the Fabaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant is often found in moist, tropical rainforests and thrives in shaded environments. It has been studied for its potential ecological roles and medicinal properties. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical research.
